description: From Middle English bride, from Old English brȳd (“bride”), from Proto-Germanic *brūdiz (“bride”). Cognate with Saterland Frisian Bräid (“bride”), West Frisian breid (“bride”), German Low German Bruut (“bride”), Dutch bruid (“bride”),  German Braut (“bride”), Danish brud (“bride”), Swedish brud (“bride”).

entries.meaning: A woman in the context of her own wedding; one who is going to marry or has just been married.
examples: Has by his own experience tried  How much the wife is dearer than the bride.

verbs.description: bride (third-person singular simple present brides, present participle briding, simple past and past participle brided)

entries.meaning: an individual loop or other device connecting the patterns in lacework
